14 //______________________________________________________________________________
15 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*The Minimization package*-*--*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
16 //*-* ======================== *
17 //*-* *
18 //*-* This package was originally written in Fortran by Fred James *
19 //*-* and part of PACKLIB (patch D506) *
20 //*-* *
21 //*-* It has been converted to a C++ class by R.Brun *
22 //*-* The current implementation in C++ is a straightforward conversion *
23 //*-* of the original Fortran version: The main changes are: *
24 //*-* *
25 //*-* - The variables in the various Minuit labelled common blocks *
26 //*-* have been changed to the TMinuit class data members. *
27 //*-* - The internal arrays with a maximum dimension depending on the *
28 //*-* maximum number of parameters are now data members arrays with *
29 //*-* a dynamic dimension such that one can fit very large problems *
30 //*-* by simply initialising the TMinuit constructor with the maximum *
31 //*-* number of parameters. *
32 //*-* - The include file Minuit.h has been commented as much as possible*
33 //*-* using existing comments in the code or the printed documentation*
34 //*-* - The original Minuit subroutines are now member functions. *
35 //*-* - Constructors and destructor have been added. *
36 //*-* - Instead of passing the FCN function in the argument *
37 //*-* list, the addresses of this function is stored as pointer *
38 //*-* in the data members of the class. This is by far more elegant *
39 //*-* and flexible in an interactive environment. *
40 //*-* The member function SetFCN can be used to define this pointer. *
41 //*-* - The ROOT static function Printf is provided to replace all *
42 //*-* format statements and to print on currently defined output file.*
43 //*-* - The functions SetObjectFit(TObject *obj)/GetObjectFit() can be *
44 //*-* used inside the FCN function to set/get a referenced object *
45 //*-* instead of using global variables. *
46 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
47 //BEGIN_HTML <!--
48 /* -->
49 <P>
50 <H2><A NAME=H2Basic-concepts-of-MINUIT.html>Basic concepts of MINUIT</A></H2>
51 <P>
52 The <A HREF="http://wwwinfo.cern.ch/asdoc/minuit/minmain.html"> MINUIT</A> package acts on a multiparameter Fortran function to which one
53 must give the generic name <TT>FCN</TT>. In the ROOT implementation,
54 the function <TT>FCN</TT> is defined via the MINUIT SetFCN member function
55 when an Histogram.Fit command is invoked.
56 The value of <TT>FCN</TT> will in general depend on one
57 or more variable parameters.
58 <P>
59 To take a simple example, in case of ROOT histograms (classes TH1C,TH1S,TH1F,TH1D)
60 the Fit function defines the Minuit fitting function as being H1FitChisquare
61 or H1FitLikelihood depending on the options selected.
62 H1FitChisquare
63 calculates the chisquare between the user fitting function (gaussian, polynomial,
64 user defined,etc) and the data for given values of the parameters.
65 It is the task of MINUIT to find those values of the parameters
66 which give the lowest value of chisquare.
67 <P>
68 <H3>Basic concepts - The transformation for parameters with limits.</H3>
69 <P>
70 For variable parameters with limits, MINUIT uses the following
71 transformation:
72 <P>
73 <PRE>
74  P = arcsin(2((P -a)/(b- a))-1) P = a+((b- a)/(2))(sinP +1)
75  int ext ext int
76 </PRE>
77 <P>
78 so that the internal value P can take on any value, while the external
79  int
80 value P can take on values only between the lower limit a and the
81  ext
82 upper limit b. Since the transformation is necessarily non-linear, it
83 would transform a nice linear problem into a nasty non-linear one, which
84 is the reason why limits should be avoided if not necessary. In addition,
85 the transformation does require some computer time, so it slows down the
86 computation a little bit, and more importantly, it introduces additional
87 numerical inaccuracy into the problem in addition to what is introduced in
88 the numerical calculation of the <TT>FCN</TT> value. The effects of
89 non-linearity and numerical roundoff both become more important as the
90 external value gets closer to one of the limits (expressed as the distance
91 to nearest limit divided by distance between limits). The user must
92 therefore be aware of the fact that, for example, if he puts limits of
93 (0,10^10 ) on a parameter, then the values 0.0 and 1. 0 will be
94 indistinguishable to the accuracy of most machines.
95 <P>
96 The transformation also affects the parameter error matrix, of course, so
97 MINUIT does a transformation of the error matrix (and the ``parabolic''
98 parameter errors) when there are parameter limits. Users should however
99 realize that the transformation is only a linear approximation, and that
100 it cannot give a meaningful result if one or more parameters is very close
101 to a limit, where partial Pext /partial Pint #0. Therefore, it is
102 recommended that:
103 <P>
104 <OL>
105 <LI>Limits on variable parameters should be used only when needed in order
106 to prevent the parameter from taking on unphysical values.
107 <LI>When a satisfactory minimum has been found using limits, the limits
108 should then be removed if possible, in order to perform or re-perform the
109 error analysis without limits.
110 </OL>
111 <P>
112 <H3>How to get the right answer from MINUIT.</H3>
113 <P>
114 MINUIT offers the user a choice of several minimization algorithms. The
115 MIGRAD algorithm is in general the best minimizer for
116 nearly all functions. It is a variable-metric method with inexact line
117 search, a stable metric updating scheme, and checks for
118 positive-definiteness. Its main weakness is that it depends heavily on
119 knowledge of the first derivatives, and fails miserably if they are very
120 inaccurate.
121 <P>
122 If parameter limits are needed, in spite of the side effects, then the
123 user should be aware of the following techniques to alleviate problems
124 caused by limits:
125 <P>
126 <H4>Getting the right minimum with limits.</H4>
127 <P>
128 If MIGRAD converges normally to a point where no parameter is near one of
129 its limits, then the existence of limits has probably not prevented MINUIT
130 from finding the right minimum. On the other hand, if one or more
131 parameters is near its limit at the minimum, this may be because the true
132 minimum is indeed at a limit, or it may be because the minimizer has
133 become ``blocked'' at a limit. This may normally happen only if the
134 parameter is so close to a limit (internal value at an odd multiple of #((pi)/(2))
135 that MINUIT prints a warning to this effect when it prints
136 the parameter values.
137 
138 The minimizer can become blocked at a limit, because at a limit the
139 derivative seen by the minimizer partial F/partial Pint is zero no matter
140 what the real derivative partial F/partial Pext is.
141 <P>
142 <P>
143 <PRE>
144 ((partial F)/(partial P ))= ((partial F)/(partial P ))((partial P )/(partial P )) =((partial F)/(partial P ))= 0
145  int ext ext int ext
146 </PRE>
147 <P>
148 <P>
149 <H4>Getting the right parameter errors with limits.</H4>
150 <P>
151 In the best case, where the minimum is far from any limits, MINUIT will
152 correctly transform the error matrix, and the parameter errors it reports
153 should be accurate and very close to those you would have got without
154 limits. In other cases (which should be more common, since otherwise you
155 wouldn't need limits), the very meaning of parameter errors becomes
156 problematic. Mathematically, since the limit is an absolute constraint on
157 the parameter, a parameter at its limit has no error, at least in one
158 direction. The error matrix, which can assign only symmetric errors, then
159 becomes essentially meaningless.
160 <P>
161 <H3>Interpretation of Parameter Errors:</H3>
162 <P>
163 There are two kinds of problems that can arise: the reliability of
164 MINUIT's error estimates, and their statistical interpretation, assuming
165 they are accurate.
166 <P>
167 <H3>Statistical interpretation:</H3>
168 <P>
169 For discussuion of basic concepts, such as the meaning of the elements of
170 the error matrix, or setting of exact confidence levels see:
171 <ol>
172  <li>F.James.
173  Determining the statistical Significance of experimental Results.
174  Technical Report DD/81/02 and CERN Report 81-03, CERN, 1981.</li>
175 
176  <li>W.T.Eadie, D.Drijard, F.James, M.Roos, and B.Sadoulet.
177  Statistical Methods in Experimental Physics.
178  North-Holland, 1971.</li>
179 </ol>
180 <P>
181 <H3>Reliability of MINUIT error estimates.</H3>
182 <P>
183 MINUIT always carries around its own current estimates of the parameter
184 errors, which it will print out on request, no matter how accurate they
185 are at any given point in the execution. For example, at initialization,
186 these estimates are just the starting step sizes as specified by the user.
187 After a HESSE step, the errors are usually quite accurate,
188 unless there has been a problem. MINUIT, when it prints out error values,
189 also gives some indication of how reliable it thinks they are. For
190 example, those marked <TT>CURRENT GUESS ERROR</TT> are only working values
191 not to be believed, and <TT>APPROXIMATE ERROR</TT> means that they have
192 been calculated but there is reason to believe that they may not be
193 accurate.
194 <P>
195 If no mitigating adjective is given, then at least MINUIT believes the
196 errors are accurate, although there is always a small chance that MINUIT
197 has been fooled. Some visible signs that MINUIT may have been fooled are:
198 <P>
199 <OL>
200 <LI>Warning messages produced during the minimization or error analysis.
201 <LI>Failure to find new minimum.
202 <LI>Value of <TT>EDM</TT> too big (estimated Distance to Minimum).
203 <LI>Correlation coefficients exactly equal to zero, unless some parameters
204 are known to be uncorrelated with the others.
205 <LI>Correlation coefficients very close to one (greater than 0.99). This
206 indicates both an exceptionally difficult problem, and one which has been
207 badly parameterized so that individual errors are not very meaningful
208 because they are so highly correlated.
209 <LI>Parameter at limit. This condition, signalled by a MINUIT warning
210 message, may make both the function minimum and parameter errors
211 unreliable. See the discussion above ``Getting the right parameter errors
212 with limits''.
213 </OL>
214 <P>
215 The best way to be absolutely sure of the errors, is to use
216 ``independent'' calculations and compare them, or compare the calculated
217 errors with a picture of the function. Theoretically, the covariance
218 matrix for a ``physical'' function must be positive-definite at the
219 minimum, although it may not be so for all points far away from the
220 minimum, even for a well-determined physical problem. Therefore, if MIGRAD
221 reports that it has found a non-positive-definite covariance matrix, this
222 may be a sign of one or more of the following:
223 <P>
224 <H5>A non-physical region:</H5>
225 <P>
226 On its way to the minimum, MIGRAD may have traversed a region which has
227 unphysical behaviour, which is of course not a serious problem as long as
228 it recovers and leaves such a region.
229 <P>
230 <H5>An underdetermined problem:</H5>
231 <P>
232 If the matrix is not positive-definite even at the minimum, this may mean
233 that the solution is not well-defined, for example that there are more
234 unknowns than there are data points, or that the parameterization of the
235 fit contains a linear dependence. If this is the case, then MINUIT (or any
236 other program) cannot solve your problem uniquely, and the error matrix
237 will necessarily be largely meaningless, so the user must remove the
238 underdeterminedness by reformulating the parameterization. MINUIT cannot
239 do this itself.
240 <P>
241 <H5>Numerical inaccuracies:</H5>
242 <P>
243 It is possible that the apparent lack of positive-definiteness is in fact
244 only due to excessive roundoff errors in numerical calculations in the
245 user function or not enough precision. This is unlikely in general, but
246 becomes more likely if the number of free parameters is very large, or if
247 
248 the parameters are badly scaled (not all of the same order of magnitude),
249 and correlations are also large. In any case, whether the
250 non-positive-definiteness is real or only numerical is largely irrelevant,
251 since in both cases the error matrix will be unreliable and the minimum
252 suspicious.
253 <P>
254 <H5>An ill-posed problem:</H5>
255 <P>
256 For questions of parameter dependence, see the discussion above on
257 positive-definiteness.
258 <P>
259 Possible other mathematical problems are the following:
260 <P>
261 <H5>Excessive numerical roundoff:</H5>
262 <P>
263 Be especially careful of exponential and factorial functions which get big
264 very quickly and lose accuracy.
265 <P>
266 <H5>Starting too far from the solution:</H5>
267 <P>
268 The function may have unphysical local minima, especially at infinity in
269 some variables.
270 
271 <H5>Minuit parameter errors in the presence of limits</H5>
272 This concerns the way Minuit reports the symmetric (or parabolic) errors
273 on parameters. It does not apply to the errors reported from Minos, which
274 are in general asymmetric.
275 <P>
276 The symmetric errors reported by Minuit are always calculated from
277 the covariance matrix, assuming that this matrix has been calculated,
278 usually as the result of a Migrad minimization or a direct
279 calculation by Hesse which inverts the second derivative matrix.
280 <P>
281 When there are no limits on the parameter in question, the error reported
282 by Minuit should therefore be exactly equal to the square root of the
283 corresponding diagonal element of the error matrix reported by Minuit.
284 <P>
285 However, when there are limits on the parameter, there is a transformation
286 between the internal parameter values seen by Minuit (which are unbounded)
287 and the external parameter values seen by the user in FCN (which remain
288 inside the desired limits). Therefore the internal error matrix kept by
289 Minuit must be transformed to an external error matrix for the user.
290 This is done by multiplying the (I,J)th element by DEXDIN(I)*DEXDIN(J),
291 where DEXDIN is the derivative of the external value with respect to the
292 internal value at the minimum. This is a linearization of the
293 transformation, and is the only way to produce an error matrix in external
294 coordinates meaningful to the user. But when reporting the individual
295 parabolic errors for limited parameters, Minuit can do a little better, so
296 it does. In this case, Minuit actually transforms the ends of the
297 internal "error bar" to external coordinates and reports the length of
298 this transformed interval. Strictly speaking, it is now asymmetric, but
299 since the origin of the asymmetry is only an artificial transformation it
300 does not make much sense, so the transformed errors are symmetrized.
301 <P>
302 The result of all the above is that for parameters with limits, the error
303 reported by Minuit is not exactly equal to the square root of the diagonal
304 element of the error matrix. The difference is a measure of how much the
305 limits deform the problem. If possible, it is suggested not to use limits
306 on parameters, and the problem goes away. If for some reason limits are
307 necessary, and you are sensitive to the difference between the two ways of
308 calculating the errors, it is suggested to use Minos errors which take
309 into account the non-linearities much more precisely.
310 
311 <!--*/
312 // -->END_HTML
313

321 TMinuit* TMinuit::gMinuit = 0;
322 
323 const char charal[29] = " .ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ";
324 
325 // Stupid little helper method because std::string doesn't have basic functionality...
326 void toUpper(string& str) {
327  for(unsigned int i = 0; i < str.size(); ++i) {
328  str[i] = toupper(str[i]);
329  }
330 }
331 
332 bool contains(string& toLookIn, string toLookFor) {
333  return (toLookIn.find(toLookFor) != string::npos);
334 }
335 
336 #include "stdarg.h"
337 // Why oh why can't C++ do strings?
338 string local_Form(const char* va_fmt, ...) {
339  static char strbuffer[10000];
340  va_list ap;
341  va_start(ap, va_fmt);
342  vsnprintf(strbuffer, 10000, va_fmt, ap); // Use vsn, not sn, when we are passing a vararg list and not a strict vararg.
343  va_end(ap);
344 
345  string ret(strbuffer);
346  return ret;
347 }

353 //______________________________________________________________________________
354 TMinuit::TMinuit(int maxpar) {
355 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*Minuit normal constructor*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
356 //*-* ========================
357 //
358 // maxpar is the maximum number of parameters used with this TMinuit object.
359 
360  fFCN = 0;
361 
362  BuildArrays(maxpar);
363 
364  fStatus = 0;
365  fEmpty = 0;
366  //fObjectFit = 0;
367  //fMethodCall = 0;
368  //fPlot = 0;
369  //fGraphicsMode = true;
370  SetMaxIterations();
371 
372  mninit(5, 6, 7);
373  gMinuit = this;
374 }
375 
376 //______________________________________________________________________________
377 TMinuit::~TMinuit() {
378 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*Minuit default destructor*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
379 //*-* =========================
380 
381  DeleteArrays();
382 
383  //delete fPlot;
384  //delete fMethodCall;
385  //gROOT->GetListOfSpecials()->Remove(this);
386  if(gMinuit == this)
387  gMinuit = 0;
388 }
389 
390 //______________________________________________________________________________
391 void TMinuit::BuildArrays(int maxpar) {
392 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*Create internal Minuit arrays for the maxpar parameters*-*-*-*
393 //*-* =======================================================
394 
395  fMaxpar = 25;
396 
397  if(maxpar >= fMaxpar)
398  fMaxpar = maxpar+1;
399 
400  fMaxpar1= fMaxpar*(fMaxpar+1);
401  fMaxpar2= 2*fMaxpar;
402  fMaxpar5= fMaxpar1/2;
403  fMaxcpt = 101;
404  fCpnam = new string[fMaxpar2];
405  fU = new double[fMaxpar2];
406  fAlim = new double[fMaxpar2];
407  fBlim = new double[fMaxpar2];
408  fPstar = new double[fMaxpar2];
409  fGin = new double[fMaxpar2];
410  fNvarl = new int[fMaxpar2];
411  fNiofex = new int[fMaxpar2];
412 
413  fNexofi = new int[fMaxpar];
414  fIpfix = new int[fMaxpar];
415  fErp = new double[fMaxpar];
416  fErn = new double[fMaxpar];
417  fWerr = new double[fMaxpar];
418  fGlobcc = new double[fMaxpar];
419  fX = new double[fMaxpar];
420  fXt = new double[fMaxpar];
421  fDirin = new double[fMaxpar];
422  fXs = new double[fMaxpar];
423  fXts = new double[fMaxpar];
424  fDirins = new double[fMaxpar];
425  fGrd = new double[fMaxpar];
426  fG2 = new double[fMaxpar];
427  fGstep = new double[fMaxpar];
428  fDgrd = new double[fMaxpar];
429  fGrds = new double[fMaxpar];
430  fG2s = new double[fMaxpar];
431  fGsteps = new double[fMaxpar];
432  fPstst = new double[fMaxpar];
433  fPbar = new double[fMaxpar];
434  fPrho = new double[fMaxpar];
435  fWord7 = new double[fMaxpar];
436  fVhmat = new double[fMaxpar5];
437  fVthmat = new double[fMaxpar5];
438  fP = new double[fMaxpar1];
439  fXpt = new double[fMaxcpt];
440  fYpt = new double[fMaxcpt];
441  fChpt = new char[fMaxcpt+1];
442  // initialisation of dynamic arrays used internally in some functions
443  // these arrays had a fix dimension in Minuit
444  fCONTgcc = new double[fMaxpar];
445  fCONTw = new double[fMaxpar];
446  fFIXPyy = new double[fMaxpar];
447  fGRADgf = new double[fMaxpar];
448  fHESSyy = new double[fMaxpar];
449  fIMPRdsav = new double[fMaxpar];
450  fIMPRy = new double[fMaxpar];
451  fMATUvline = new double[fMaxpar];
452  fMIGRflnu = new double[fMaxpar];
453  fMIGRstep = new double[fMaxpar];
454  fMIGRgs = new double[fMaxpar];
455  fMIGRvg = new double[fMaxpar];
456  fMIGRxxs = new double[fMaxpar];
457  fMNOTxdev = new double[fMaxpar];
458  fMNOTw = new double[fMaxpar];
459  fMNOTgcc = new double[fMaxpar];
460  fPSDFs = new double[fMaxpar];
461  fSEEKxmid = new double[fMaxpar];
462  fSEEKxbest = new double[fMaxpar];
463  fSIMPy = new double[fMaxpar];
464  fVERTq = new double[fMaxpar];
465  fVERTs = new double[fMaxpar];
466  fVERTpp = new double[fMaxpar];
467  fCOMDplist = new double[fMaxpar];
468  fPARSplist = new double[fMaxpar];
469 
470  for(int i = 0; i < fMaxpar; i++) {
471  fErp[i] = 0;
472  fErn[i] = 0;
473  }
474 }
475 
476 //______________________________________________________________________________
477 int TMinuit::Command(const char* command) {
478 // execute a Minuit command
479 // Equivalent to MNEXCM except that the command is given as a
480 // character string.
481 // See TMinuit::mnhelp for the full list of available commands
482 // See also http://wwwasdoc.web.cern.ch/wwwasdoc/minuit/node18.html for
483 // a complete documentation of all the available commands
484 //
485 // Returns the status of the execution:
486 // = 0: command executed normally
487 // 1: command is blank, ignored
488 // 2: command line unreadable, ignored
489 // 3: unknown command, ignored
490 // 4: abnormal termination (e.g., MIGRAD not converged)
491 // 5: command is a request to read PARAMETER definitions
492 // 6: 'SET INPUT' command
493 // 7: 'SET TITLE' command
494 // 8: 'SET COVAR' command
495 // 9: reserved
496 // 10: END command
497 // 11: EXIT or STOP command
498 // 12: RETURN command
499 //
500 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
501 
502  int status = 0;
503  mncomd(command, status);
504  return status;
505 }
506 
507 //______________________________________________________________________________
508 #ifdef NEEDS_CAREFUL_CONVERSION
509 TObject* TMinuit::Contour(int npoints, int pa1, int pa2) {
510  // Creates a TGraph object describing the n-sigma contour of a
511  // TMinuit fit. The contour of the parameters pa1 and pa2 is calculated
512  // unsing npoints (>=4) points. The TMinuit status will be
513  // 0 on success and
514  // -1 if errors in the calling sequence (pa1, pa2 not variable)
515  // 1 if less than four points can be found
516  // 2 if npoints<4
517  // n>3 if only n points can be found (n < npoints)
518  // The status can be obtained via TMinuit::GetStatus().
519  //
520  // To get the n-sigma contour the ERRDEF parameter in Minuit has to set
521  // to n^2. The fcn function has to be set before the routine is called.
522  //
523  // The TGraph object is created via the interpreter. The user must cast it
524  // to a TGraph*. Note that the TGraph is created with npoints+1 in order to
525  // close the contour (setting last point equal to first point).
526  //
527  // You can find an example in $ROOTSYS/tutorials/fit/fitcont.C
528 
529  if(npoints<4) {
530  // we need at least 4 points
531  fStatus= 2;
532  return (TObject*)0;
533  }
534 
535  int npfound;
536  double* xcoor = new double[npoints+1];
537  double* ycoor = new double[npoints+1];
538  mncont(pa1, pa2, npoints, xcoor, ycoor, npfound);
539 
540  if(npfound<4) {
541  // mncont did go wrong
542  Warning("Contour", "Cannot find more than 4 points, no TGraph returned");
543  fStatus= (npfound==0 ? 1 : npfound);
544  delete [] xcoor;
545  delete [] ycoor;
546  return (TObject*)0;
547  }
548 
549  if(npfound!=npoints) {
550  // mncont did go wrong
551  Warning("Contour", "Returning a TGraph with %d points only", npfound);
552  npoints = npfound;
553  }
554 
555  fStatus=0;
556  // create graph via the PluginManager
557  xcoor[npoints] = xcoor[0]; // add first point at end to get closed polyline
558  ycoor[npoints] = ycoor[0];
559  TObject* gr = 0;
560  TPluginHandler* h;
561 
562  if((h = gROOT->GetPluginManager()->FindHandler("TMinuitGraph"))) {
563  if(h->LoadPlugin() != -1)
564  gr = (TObject*)h->ExecPlugin(3, npoints+1, xcoor, ycoor);
565  }
566 
567  delete [] xcoor;
568  delete [] ycoor;
569  return gr;
570 }
571 #endif
572 
573 //______________________________________________________________________________
574 int TMinuit::DefineParameter(int parNo, const char* name, double initVal, double initErr, double lowerLimit,
575  double upperLimit) {
576 // Define a parameter
577 
578  int err;
579 
580  string sname = name;
581  mnparm(parNo, sname, initVal, initErr, lowerLimit, upperLimit, err);
582 
583  return err;
584 }
585 
586 //______________________________________________________________________________
587 void TMinuit::DeleteArrays() {
588 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*Delete internal Minuit arrays*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
589 //*-* =============================
590  if(fEmpty)
591  return;
592 
593  delete [] fCpnam;
594  delete [] fU;
595  delete [] fAlim;
596  delete [] fBlim;
597  delete [] fErp;
598  delete [] fErn;
599  delete [] fWerr;
600  delete [] fGlobcc;
601  delete [] fNvarl;
602  delete [] fNiofex;
603  delete [] fNexofi;
604  delete [] fX;
605  delete [] fXt;
606  delete [] fDirin;
607  delete [] fXs;
608  delete [] fXts;
609  delete [] fDirins;
610  delete [] fGrd;
611  delete [] fG2;
612  delete [] fGstep;
613  delete [] fGin;
614  delete [] fDgrd;
615  delete [] fGrds;
616  delete [] fG2s;
617  delete [] fGsteps;
618  delete [] fIpfix;
619  delete [] fVhmat;
620  delete [] fVthmat;
621  delete [] fP;
622  delete [] fPstar;
623  delete [] fPstst;
624  delete [] fPbar;
625  delete [] fPrho;
626  delete [] fWord7;
627  delete [] fXpt;
628  delete [] fYpt;
629  delete [] fChpt;
630 
631  delete [] fCONTgcc;
632  delete [] fCONTw;
633  delete [] fFIXPyy;
634  delete [] fGRADgf;
635  delete [] fHESSyy;
636  delete [] fIMPRdsav;
637  delete [] fIMPRy;
638  delete [] fMATUvline;
639  delete [] fMIGRflnu;
640  delete [] fMIGRstep;
641  delete [] fMIGRgs;
642  delete [] fMIGRvg;
643  delete [] fMIGRxxs;
644  delete [] fMNOTxdev;
645  delete [] fMNOTw;
646  delete [] fMNOTgcc;
647  delete [] fPSDFs;
648  delete [] fSEEKxmid;
649  delete [] fSEEKxbest;
650  delete [] fSIMPy;
651  delete [] fVERTq;
652  delete [] fVERTs;
653  delete [] fVERTpp;
654  delete [] fCOMDplist;
655  delete [] fPARSplist;
656 
657  fEmpty = 1;
658 }
659 
660 //______________________________________________________________________________
661 int TMinuit::Eval(int npar, double* grad, double& fval, double* par, int flag) {
662 // Evaluate the minimisation function
663 // Input parameters:
664 // npar: number of currently variable parameters
665 // par: array of (constant and variable) parameters
666 // flag: Indicates what is to be calculated (see example below)
667 // grad: array of gradients
668 // Output parameters:
669 // fval: The calculated function value.
670 // grad: The (optional) vector of first derivatives).
671 //
672 // The meaning of the parameters par is of course defined by the user,
673 // who uses the values of those parameters to calculate his function value.
674 // The starting values must be specified by the user.
675 // Later values are determined by Minuit as it searches for the minimum
676 // or performs whatever analysis is requested by the user.
677 //
678 // Note that this virtual function may be redefined in a class derived from TMinuit.
679 // The default function calls the function specified in SetFCN
680 //
681 // Example of Minimisation function:
682  /*
683  if (flag == 1) {
684  read input data,
685  calculate any necessary constants, etc.
686  }
687  if (flag == 2) {
688  calculate GRAD, the first derivatives of FVAL
689  (this is optional)
690  }
691  Always calculate the value of the function, FVAL,
692  which is usually a chisquare or log likelihood.
693  if (iflag == 3) {
694  will come here only after the fit is finished.
695  Perform any final calculations, output fitted data, etc.
696  }
697  */
698 // See concrete examples in TH1::H1FitChisquare, H1FitLikelihood
699 
700  if(fFCN)
701  (*fFCN)(npar, grad, fval, par, flag);
702 
703  return 0;
704 }
705 
706 //______________________________________________________________________________
707 int TMinuit::FixParameter(int parNo) {
708 // fix a parameter
709 
710  int err;
711  double tmp[1];
712  tmp[0] = parNo+1; //set internal Minuit numbering
713 
714  mnexcm("FIX", tmp, 1, err);
715 
716  return err;
717 }
718 
719 //______________________________________________________________________________
720 int TMinuit::GetParameter(int parNo, double& currentValue, double& currentError) const {
721 // return parameter value and error
722  int err;
723  string name; // ignored
724  double bnd1, bnd2; // ignored
725 
726  mnpout(parNo, name, currentValue, currentError, bnd1, bnd2, err);
727 
728  return err;
729 }
730 
731 //______________________________________________________________________________
732 int TMinuit::GetNumFixedPars() const {
733 // returns the number of currently fixed parameters
734 
735  return fNpfix;
736 }
737 
738 //______________________________________________________________________________
739 int TMinuit::GetNumFreePars() const {
740 // returns the number of currently free parameters
741 
742  return fNpar;
743 }
744 
745 //______________________________________________________________________________
746 int TMinuit::GetNumPars() const {
747 // returns the total number of parameters that have been defined.
748 // (fixed and free)
749 
750  return fNpar + fNpfix;
751 }
752 
753 //______________________________________________________________________________
754 int TMinuit::Migrad() {
755 // invokes the MIGRAD minimizer
756  int err;
757  double tmp[1];
758  tmp[0] = 0;
759 
760  mnexcm("MIGRAD", tmp, 0, err);
761 
762  return err;
763 }
764 
765 //______________________________________________________________________________
766 int TMinuit::Release(int parNo) {
767 // release a parameter
768 
769  int err;
770  double tmp[1];
771  tmp[0] = parNo+1; //set internal Minuit numbering
772 
773  mnexcm("RELEASE", tmp, 1, err);
774 
775  return err;
776 }
777 
778 //______________________________________________________________________________
779 int TMinuit::SetErrorDef(double up) {
780 // To get the n-sigma contour the error def parameter "up" has to set to n^2.
781 
782  int err;
783 
784  mnexcm("SET ERRDEF", &up, 1, err);
785 
786  return err;
787 }
788 
789 //______________________________________________________________________________
790 void TMinuit::SetFCN(void (*fcn)(int&, double*, double& f, double*, int)) {
791 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*To set the address of the minimization function*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
792 //*-* ===============================================
793 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
794  fFCN = fcn;
795 }
796 
797 //______________________________________________________________________________
798 int TMinuit::SetPrintLevel(int printLevel) {
799  //set Minuit print level
800  // printlevel = -1 quiet (also suppresse all warnings)
801  // = 0 normal
802  // = 1 verbose
803  int err;
804  double tmp[1];
805  tmp[0] = printLevel;
806 
807  mnexcm("SET PRINT", tmp, 1, err);
808 
809  if(printLevel <=-1)
810  mnexcm("SET NOWarnings", tmp, 0, err);
811 
812  return err;
813 }
814 
815 //______________________________________________________________________________
816 void TMinuit::mnamin() {
817 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*Initialize AMIN*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
818 //*-* ===============
819 //*-*C Called from many places. Initializes the value of AMIN by
820 //*-*C calling the user function. Prints out the function value and
821 //*-*C parameter values if Print Flag value is high enough.
822 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
823 
824  /* Local variables */
825  double fnew;
826  int nparx;
827 
828  nparx = fNpar;
829 
830  if(fISW[4] >= 1) {
831  printf(" FIRST CALL TO USER FUNCTION AT NEW START POINT, WITH IFLAG=4.\n");
832  }
833 
834  mnexin(fX);
835  Eval(nparx, fGin, fnew, fU, 4);
836  ++fNfcn;
837  fAmin = fnew;
838  fEDM = fBigedm;
839 } /* mnamin_ */
840 
841 //______________________________________________________________________________
842 void TMinuit::mnbins(double a1, double a2, int naa, double& bl, double& bh, int& nb, double& bwid) {
843 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*Compute reasonable histogram intervals*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
844 //*-* ======================================
845 //*-* Function TO DETERMINE REASONABLE HISTOGRAM INTERVALS
846 //*-* GIVEN ABSOLUTE UPPER AND LOWER BOUNDS A1 AND A2
847 //*-* AND DESIRED MAXIMUM NUMBER OF BINS NAA
848 //*-* PROGRAM MAKES REASONABLE BINNING FROM BL TO BH OF WIDTH BWID
849 //*-* F. JAMES, AUGUST, 1974 , stolen for Minuit, 1988
850 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
851 
852  /* Local variables */
853  double awid, ah, al, sigfig, sigrnd, alb;
854  int kwid, lwid, na=0, log_;
855 
856  al = min(a1, a2);
857  ah = max(a1, a2);
858 
859  if(al == ah)
860  ah = al + 1;
861 
862 //*-*- IF NAA .EQ. -1 , PROGRAM USES BWID INPUT FROM CALLING ROUTINE
863  if(naa == -1)
864  goto L150;
865 
866 L10:
867  na = naa - 1;
868 
869  if(na < 1)
870  na = 1;
871 
872 //*-*- GET NOMINAL BIN WIDTH IN EXPON FORM
873 L20:
874  awid = (ah-al) / double(na);
875  log_ = int(log10(awid));
876 
877  if(awid <= 1)
878  --log_;
879 
880  sigfig = awid*pow(10.0, -log_);
881 
882 //*-*- ROUND MANTISSA UP TO 2, 2.5, 5, OR 10
883  if(sigfig > 2)
884  goto L40;
885 
886  sigrnd = 2;
887  goto L100;
888 L40:
889 
890  if(sigfig > 2.5)
891  goto L50;
892 
893  sigrnd = 2.5;
894  goto L100;
895 L50:
896 
897  if(sigfig > 5)
898  goto L60;
899 
900  sigrnd = 5;
901  goto L100;
902 L60:
903  sigrnd = 1;
904  ++log_;
905 L100:
906  bwid = sigrnd*pow(10.0, log_);
907  goto L200;
908 //*-*- GET NEW BOUNDS FROM NEW WIDTH BWID
909 L150:
910 
911  if(bwid <= 0)
912  goto L10;
913 
914 L200:
915  alb = al / bwid;
916  lwid = int(alb);
917 
918  if(alb < 0)
919  --lwid;
920 
921  bl = bwid*double(lwid);
922  alb = ah / bwid + 1;
923  kwid = int(alb);
924 
925  if(alb < 0)
926  --kwid;
927 
928  bh = bwid*double(kwid);
929  nb = kwid - lwid;
930 
931  if(naa > 5)
932  goto L240;
933 
934  if(naa == -1)
935  return;
936 
937 //*-*- REQUEST FOR ONE BIN IS DIFFICULT CASE
938  if(naa > 1 || nb == 1)
939  return;
940 
941  bwid *= 2;
942  nb = 1;
943  return;
944 L240:
945 
946  if(nb << 1 != naa)
947  return;
948 
949  ++na;
950  goto L20;
951 } /* mnbins_ */
952 
953 //______________________________________________________________________________
954 void TMinuit::mncalf(double* pvec, double& ycalf) {
955 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*Transform FCN to find further minima*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
956 //*-* ====================================
957 //*-* Called only from MNIMPR. Transforms the function FCN
958 //*-* by dividing out the quadratic part in order to find further
959 //*-* minima. Calculates ycalf = (f-fmin)/(x-xmin)*v*(x-xmin)
960 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
961 
962  /* Local variables */
963  int ndex, i, j, m, n, nparx;
964  double denom, f;
965 
966  nparx = fNpar;
967  mninex(&pvec[0]);
968  Eval(nparx, fGin, f, fU, 4);
969  ++fNfcn;
970 
971  for(i = 1; i <= fNpar; ++i) {
972  fGrd[i-1] = 0;
973 
974  for(j = 1; j <= fNpar; ++j) {
975  m = max(i, j);
976  n = min(i, j);
977  ndex = m*(m-1) / 2 + n;
978  fGrd[i-1] += fVthmat[ndex-1]*(fXt[j-1] - pvec[j-1]);
979  }
980  }
981 
982  denom = 0;
983 
984  for(i = 1; i <= fNpar; ++i) {
985  denom += fGrd[i-1]*(fXt[i-1] - pvec[i-1]);
986  }
987 
988  if(denom <= 0) {
989  fDcovar = 1;
990  fISW[1] = 0;
991  denom = 1;
992  }
993 
994  ycalf = (f - fApsi) / denom;
995 } /* mncalf_ */
996 
997 //______________________________________________________________________________
998 void TMinuit::mncler() {
999 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*Resets the parameter list to UNDEFINED*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
1000 //*-* ======================================
1001 //*-* Called from MINUIT and by option from MNEXCM
1002 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
1003 
1004  int i;
1005 
1006  fNpfix = 0;
1007  fNu = 0;
1008  fNpar = 0;
1009  fNfcn = 0;
1010  fNwrmes[0] = 0;
1011  fNwrmes[1] = 0;
1012 
1013  for(i = 1; i <= fMaxext; ++i) {
1014  fU[i-1] = 0;
1015  fCpnam[i-1] = fCundef;
1016  fNvarl[i-1] = -1;
1017  fNiofex[i-1] = 0;
1018  }
1019 
1020  mnrset(1);
1021  fCfrom = "CLEAR ";
1022  fNfcnfr = fNfcn;
1023  fCstatu = "UNDEFINED ";
1024  fLnolim = true;
1025  fLphead = true;
1026 } /* mncler_ */
1027 
1028 //______________________________________________________________________________
1029 void TMinuit::mncntr(int ike1, int ike2, int& ierrf) {
1030 //*-*-*-*-*Print function contours in two variables, on line printer*-*-*-*-*
1031 //*-* =========================================================
1032 //*-*
1033 //*-* input arguments: parx, pary, devs, ngrid
1034 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
1035 
1036  static string clabel = "0123456789ABCDEFGHIJ";
1037 
1038  /* Local variables */
1039  double d__1, d__2;
1040  double fcna[115], fcnb[115], contur[20];
1041  double ylabel, fmn, fmx, xlo, ylo, xup, yup;
1042  double devs, xsav, ysav, bwidx, bwidy, unext, ff, xb4;
1043  int i, ngrid, ixmid, nparx, ix, nx, ny, ki1, ki2, ixzero, iy, ics;
1044  string chmid, chln, chzero;
1045 
1046  int ke1 = ike1+1;
1047  int ke2 = ike2+1;
1048 
1049  if(ke1 <= 0 || ke2 <= 0)
1050  goto L1350;
1051 
1052  if(ke1 > fNu || ke2 > fNu)
1053  goto L1350;
1054 
1055  ki1 = fNiofex[ke1-1];
1056  ki2 = fNiofex[ke2-1];
1057 
1058  if(ki1 <= 0 || ki2 <= 0)
1059  goto L1350;
1060 
1061  if(ki1 == ki2)
1062  goto L1350;
1063 
1064  if(fISW[1] < 1) {
1065  mnhess();
1066  mnwerr();
1067  }
1068 
1069  nparx = fNpar;
1070  xsav = fU[ke1-1];
1071  ysav = fU[ke2-1];
1072  devs = fWord7[2];
1073 
1074  if(devs <= 0)
1075  devs = 2;
1076 
1077  xlo = fU[ke1-1] - devs*fWerr[ki1-1];
1078  xup = fU[ke1-1] + devs*fWerr[ki1-1];
1079  ylo = fU[ke2-1] - devs*fWerr[ki2-1];
1080  yup = fU[ke2-1] + devs*fWerr[ki2-1];
1081  ngrid = int(fWord7[3]);
1082 
1083  if(ngrid <= 0) {
1084  ngrid = 25;
1085 //*-* Computing MIN
1086  nx = min(fNpagwd - 15, ngrid);
1087 //*-* Computing MIN
1088  ny = min(fNpagln - 7, ngrid);
1089  } else {
1090  nx = ngrid;
1091  ny = ngrid;
1092  }
1093 
1094  if(nx < 11)
1095  nx = 11;
1096 
1097  if(ny < 11)
1098  ny = 11;
1099 
1100  if(nx >= 115)
1101  nx = 114;
1102 
1103 //*-*- ask if parameter outside limits
1104  if(fNvarl[ke1-1] > 1) {
1105  if(xlo < fAlim[ke1-1])
1106  xlo = fAlim[ke1-1];
1107 
1108  if(xup > fBlim[ke1-1])
1109  xup = fBlim[ke1-1];
1110  }
1111 
1112  if(fNvarl[ke2-1] > 1) {
1113  if(ylo < fAlim[ke2-1])
1114  ylo = fAlim[ke2-1];
1115 
1116  if(yup > fBlim[ke2-1])
1117  yup = fBlim[ke2-1];
1118  }
1119 
1120  bwidx = (xup - xlo) / double(nx);
1121  bwidy = (yup - ylo) / double(ny);
1122  ixmid = int(((xsav - xlo)*double(nx) / (xup - xlo)) + 1);
1123 
1124  if(fAmin == fUndefi)
1125  mnamin();
1126 
1127  for(i = 1; i <= 20; ++i) {
1128  contur[i-1] = fAmin + fUp*(i-1)*(i-1);
1129  }
1130 
1131  contur[0] += fUp*.01;
1132 //*-*- fill FCNB to prepare first row, and find column zero/
1133  fU[ke2-1] = yup;
1134  ixzero = 0;
1135  xb4 = 1;
1136 //TH
1137  chmid.resize(nx+1);
1138  chzero.resize(nx+1);
1139  chln.resize(nx+1);
1140 
1141  for(ix = 1; ix <= nx + 1; ++ix) {
1142  fU[ke1-1] = xlo + double(ix-1)*bwidx;
1143  Eval(nparx, fGin, ff, fU, 4);
1144  fcnb[ix-1] = ff;
1145 
1146  if(xb4 < 0 && fU[ke1-1] > 0)
1147  ixzero = ix - 1;
1148 
1149  xb4 = fU[ke1-1];
1150  chmid[ix-1] = '*';
1151  chzero[ix-1] = '-';
1152  }
1153 
1154  printf(" Y-AXIS: PARAMETER %3d: %s\n", ke2, fCpnam[ke2-1].c_str());
1155 
1156  if(ixzero > 0) {
1157  chzero[ixzero-1] = '+';
1158  chln = " ";
1159  printf(" X=0\n");
1160  }
1161 
1162 //*-*- loop over rows
1163  for(iy = 1; iy <= ny; ++iy) {
1164  unext = fU[ke2-1] - bwidy;
1165 //*-*- prepare this line background pattern for contour
1166  chln = " ";
1167 // TH
1168  chln.resize(nx+1);
1169  chln[ixmid-1] = '*';
1170 
1171  if(ixzero != 0)
1172  chln[ixzero-1] = ':';
1173 
1174  if(fU[ke2-1] > ysav && unext < ysav)
1175  chln = chmid;
1176 
1177  if(fU[ke2-1] > 0 && unext < 0)
1178  chln = chzero;
1179 
1180  fU[ke2-1] = unext;
1181  ylabel = fU[ke2-1] + bwidy*.5;
1182 
1183 //*-*- move FCNB to FCNA and fill FCNB with next row
1184  for(ix = 1; ix <= nx + 1; ++ix) {
1185  fcna[ix-1] = fcnb[ix-1];
1186  fU[ke1-1] = xlo + double(ix-1)*bwidx;
1187  Eval(nparx, fGin, ff, fU, 4);
1188  fcnb[ix-1] = ff;
1189  }
1190 
1191 //*-*- look for contours crossing the FCNxy squares
1192  for(ix = 1; ix <= nx; ++ix) {
1193  d__1 = max(fcna[ix-1], fcnb[ix-1]),
1194  d__2 = max(fcna[ix], fcnb[ix]);
1195  fmx = max(d__1, d__2);
1196  d__1 = min(fcna[ix-1], fcnb[ix-1]),
1197  d__2 = min(fcna[ix], fcnb[ix]);
1198  fmn = min(d__1, d__2);
1199 
1200  for(ics = 1; ics <= 20; ++ics) {
1201  if(contur[ics-1] > fmn)
1202  goto L240;
1203  }
1204 
1205  continue;
1206 L240:
1207 
1208  if(contur[ics-1] < fmx)
1209  chln[ix-1] = clabel[ics-1];
1210  }
1211 
1212 //*-*- print a row of the contour plot
1213  printf(" %12.4g %s\n", ylabel, chln.c_str());
1214  }
1215 
1216 //*-*- contours printed, label x-axis
1217  chln = " ";
1218  chln[0] = 'I';
1219  chln[ixmid-1] = 'I';
1220  chln[nx-1] = 'I';
1221  printf(" %s\n", chln.c_str());
1222 
1223 //*-*- the hardest of all: print x-axis scale!
1224  chln = " ";
1225 
1226  if(nx <= 26) {
1227  printf(" %12.4g%s%12.4g\n", xlo, chln.c_str(), xup);
1228  printf(" %s%12.4g\n", chln.c_str(), xsav);
1229  } else {
1230  printf(" %12.4g%s%12.4g%s%12.4g\n", xlo, chln.c_str(), xsav, chln.c_str(), xup);
1231  }
1232 
1233  printf(" X-AXIS: PARAMETER %3d %s ONE COLUMN=%12.4g"
1234  , ke1, fCpnam[ke1-1].c_str(), bwidx);
1235  printf(" FUNCTION VALUES: F(I)=%12.4g +%12.4g *I**2\n", fAmin, fUp);
1236 //*-*- finished. reset input values
1237  fU[ke1-1] = xsav;
1238  fU[ke2-1] = ysav;
1239  ierrf = 0;
1240  return;
1241 L1350:
1242  printf(" INVALID PARAMETER NUMBER(S) REQUESTED. IGNORED.\n");
1243  ierrf = 1;
1244 } /* mncntr_ */
1245 
1246 //______________________________________________________________________________
1247 void TMinuit::mncomd(const char* crdbin, int& icondn) {
1248 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*Reads a command string and executes*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
1249 //*-* ===================================
1250 //*-* Called by user. 'Reads' a command string and executes.
1251 //*-* Equivalent to MNEXCM except that the command is given as a
1252 //*-* character string.
1253 //*-*
1254 //*-* ICONDN = 0: command executed normally
1255 //*-* 1: command is blank, ignored
1256 //*-* 2: command line unreadable, ignored
1257 //*-* 3: unknown command, ignored
1258 //*-* 4: abnormal termination (e.g., MIGRAD not converged)
1259 //*-* 5: command is a request to read PARAMETER definitions
1260 //*-* 6: 'SET INPUT' command
1261 //*-* 7: 'SET TITLE' command
1262 //*-* 8: 'SET COVAR' command
1263 //*-* 9: reserved
1264 //*-* 10: END command
1265 //*-* 11: EXIT or STOP command
1266 //*-* 12: RETURN command
1267 //*-*
1268 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
1269 
1270  /* Local variables */
1271  int ierr, ipos, i, llist, lenbuf, lnc;
1272  bool leader;
1273  string comand, crdbuf, ctemp;
1274 
1275  crdbuf = crdbin;
1276  toUpper(crdbuf);
1277  lenbuf = crdbuf.size();
1278  icondn = 0;
1279 //*-*- record not case-sensitive, get upper case, strip leading blanks
1280  leader = true;
1281  ipos = 1;
1282 
1283  for(i = 1; i <= min(20, lenbuf); ++i) {
1284  if(crdbuf[i-1] == '\'')
1285  break;
1286 
1287  if(crdbuf[i-1] == ' ') {
1288  if(leader)
1289  ++ipos;
1290 
1291  continue;
1292  }
1293 
1294  leader = false;
1295  }
1296 
1297 //*-*- blank or null command
1298  if(ipos > lenbuf) {
1299  printf(" BLANK COMMAND IGNORED.\n");
1300  icondn = 1;
1301  return;
1302  }
1303 
1304 //*-*- . . preemptive commands
1305 //*-*- if command is 'PARAMETER'
1306  if(crdbuf.substr(ipos-1, 3) == "PAR") {
1307  icondn = 5;
1308  fLphead = true;
1309  return;
1310  }
1311 
1312 //*-*- if command is 'SET INPUT'
1313  if(crdbuf.substr(ipos-1, 3) == "SET INP") {
1314  icondn = 6;
1315  fLphead = true;
1316  return;
1317  }
1318 
1319 //*-*- if command is 'SET TITLE'
1320  if(crdbuf.substr(ipos-1, 7) == "SET TIT") {
1321  icondn = 7;
1322  fLphead = true;
1323  return;
1324  }
1325 
1326 //*-*- if command is 'SET COVARIANCE'
1327  if(crdbuf.substr(ipos-1, 7) == "SET COV") {
1328  icondn = 8;
1329  fLphead = true;
1330  return;
1331  }
1332 
1333 //*-*- crack the command . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
1334  ctemp = crdbuf.substr(ipos-1, lenbuf-ipos+1);
1335  mncrck(ctemp, 20, comand, lnc, fMaxpar, fCOMDplist, llist, ierr, fIsyswr);
1336 
1337  if(ierr > 0) {
1338  printf(" COMMAND CANNOT BE INTERPRETED\n");
1339  icondn = 2;
1340  return;
1341  }
1342 
1343  mnexcm(comand.c_str(), fCOMDplist, llist, ierr);
1344  icondn = ierr;
1345 } /* mncomd_ */
1346 
1347 //______________________________________________________________________________
1348 void TMinuit::mncont(int ike1, int ike2, int nptu, double* xptu, double* yptu, int& ierrf) {
1349 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*Find points along a contour where FCN is minimum*-*-*-*-*-*-*
1350 //*-* ================================================
1351 //*-* Find NPTU points along a contour where the function
1352 //*-* FMIN (X(KE1),X(KE2)) = AMIN+UP
1353 //*-* where FMIN is the minimum of FCN with respect to all
1354 //*-* the other NPAR-2 variable parameters (if any).
1355 //*-* IERRF on return will be equal to the number of points found:
1356 //*-* NPTU if normal termination with NPTU points found
1357 //*-* -1 if errors in the calling sequence (KE1, KE2 not variable)
1358 //*-* 0 if less than four points can be found (using MNMNOT)
1359 //*-* n>3 if only n points can be found (n < NPTU)
1360 //*-*
1361 //*-* input arguments: parx, pary, devs, ngrid
1362 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
1363  /* System generated locals */
1364  int i__1;
1365 
1366  /* Local variables */
1367  double d__1, d__2;
1368  double dist, xdir, ydir, aopt, u1min, u2min;
1369  double abest, scalx, scaly;
1370  double a1, a2, val2mi, val2pl, dc, sclfac, bigdis, sigsav;
1371  int nall, iold, line, mpar, ierr, inew, move, next, i, j, nfcol, iercr;
1372  int idist=0, npcol, kints, i2, i1, lr, nfcnco=0, ki1, ki2, ki3, ke3;
1373  int nowpts, istrav, nfmxin, isw2, isw4;
1374  bool ldebug;
1375 
1376  /* Function Body */
1377  int ke1 = ike1+1;
1378  int ke2 = ike2+1;
1379  ldebug = fIdbg[6] >= 1;
1380 
1381  if(ke1 <= 0 || ke2 <= 0)
1382  goto L1350;
1383 
1384  if(ke1 > fNu || ke2 > fNu)
1385  goto L1350;
1386 
1387  ki1 = fNiofex[ke1-1];
1388  ki2 = fNiofex[ke2-1];
1389 
1390  if(ki1 <= 0 || ki2 <= 0)
1391  goto L1350;
1392 
1393  if(ki1 == ki2)
1394  goto L1350;
1395 
1396  if(nptu < 4)
1397  goto L1400;
1398 
1399  nfcnco = fNfcn;
1400  fNfcnmx = (nptu + 5)*100*(fNpar + 1);
1401 //*-*- The minimum
1402  mncuve();
1403  u1min = fU[ke1-1];
1404  u2min = fU[ke2-1];
1405  ierrf = 0;
1406  fCfrom = "MNContour ";
1407  fNfcnfr = nfcnco;
1408 
1409  if(fISW[4] >= 0) {
1410  printf(" START MNCONTOUR CALCULATION OF %4d POINTS ON CONTOUR.\n", nptu);
1411 
1412  if(fNpar > 2) {
1413  if(fNpar == 3) {
1414  ki3 = 6 - ki1 - ki2;
1415  ke3 = fNexofi[ki3-1];
1416  printf(" EACH POINT IS A MINIMUM WITH RESPECT TO PARAMETER %3d %s\n", ke3, fCpnam[ke3-1].c_str());
1417  } else {
1418  printf(" EACH POINT IS A MINIMUM WITH RESPECT TO THE OTHER %3d VARIABLE PARAMETERS.\n", fNpar - 2);
1419  }
1420  }
1421  }
1422 
1423 //*-*- Find the first four points using MNMNOT
1424 //*-*- ........................ first two points
1425  mnmnot(ke1, ke2, val2pl, val2mi);
1426 
1427  if(fErn[ki1-1] == fUndefi) {
1428  xptu[0] = fAlim[ke1-1];
1429  mnwarn("W", "MNContour ", "Contour squeezed by parameter limits.");
1430  } else {
1431  if(fErn[ki1-1] >= 0)
1432  goto L1500;
1433 
1434  xptu[0] = u1min + fErn[ki1-1];
1435  }
1436 
1437  yptu[0] = val2mi;
1438 
1439  if(fErp[ki1-1] == fUndefi) {
1440  xptu[2] = fBlim[ke1-1];
1441  mnwarn("W", "MNContour ", "Contour squeezed by parameter limits.");
1442  } else {
1443  if(fErp[ki1-1] <= 0)
1444  goto L1500;
1445 
1446  xptu[2] = u1min + fErp[ki1-1];
1447  }
1448 
1449  yptu[2] = val2pl;
1450  scalx = 1 / (xptu[2] - xptu[0]);
1451 //*-*- ........................... next two points
1452  mnmnot(ke2, ke1, val2pl, val2mi);
1453 
1454  if(fErn[ki2-1] == fUndefi) {
1455  yptu[1] = fAlim[ke2-1];
1456  mnwarn("W", "MNContour ", "Contour squeezed by parameter limits.");
1457  } else {
1458  if(fErn[ki2-1] >= 0)
1459  goto L1500;
1460 
1461  yptu[1] = u2min + fErn[ki2-1];
1462  }
1463 
1464  xptu[1] = val2mi;
1465 
1466  if(fErp[ki2-1] == fUndefi) {
1467  yptu[3] = fBlim[ke2-1];
1468  mnwarn("W", "MNContour ", "Contour squeezed by parameter limits.");
1469  } else {
1470  if(fErp[ki2-1] <= 0)
1471  goto L1500;
1472 
1473  yptu[3] = u2min + fErp[ki2-1];
1474  }
1475 
1476  xptu[3] = val2pl;
1477  scaly = 1 / (yptu[3] - yptu[1]);
1478  nowpts = 4;
1479  next = 5;
1480 
1481  if(ldebug) {
1482  printf(" Plot of four points found by MINOS\n");
1483  fXpt[0] = u1min;
1484  fYpt[0] = u2min;
1485  fChpt[0] = ' ';
1486 //*-* Computing MIN
1487  nall = min(nowpts + 1, 101);
1488 
1489  for(i = 2; i <= nall; ++i) {
1490  fXpt[i-1] = xptu[i-2];
1491  fYpt[i-1] = yptu[i-2];
1492  }
1493 
1494  sprintf(fChpt, "%s", " ABCD");
1495  mnplot(fXpt, fYpt, fChpt, nall, fNpagwd, fNpagln);
1496  }
1497 
1498 //*-*- ..................... save some values before fixing
1499  isw2 = fISW[1];
1500  isw4 = fISW[3];
1501  sigsav = fEDM;
1502  istrav = fIstrat;
1503  dc = fDcovar;
1504  fApsi = fEpsi*.5;
1505  abest = fAmin;
1506  mpar = fNpar;
1507  nfmxin = fNfcnmx;
1508 
1509  for(i = 1; i <= mpar; ++i) {
1510  fXt[i-1] = fX[i-1];
1511  }
1512 
1513  i__1 = mpar*(mpar + 1) / 2;
1514 
1515  for(j = 1; j <= i__1; ++j) {
1516  fVthmat[j-1] = fVhmat[j-1];
1517  }
1518 
1519  for(i = 1; i <= mpar; ++i) {
1520  fCONTgcc[i-1] = fGlobcc[i-1];
1521  fCONTw[i-1] = fWerr[i-1];
1522  }
1523 
1524 //*-*- fix the two parameters in question
1525  kints = fNiofex[ke1-1];
1526  mnfixp(kints-1, ierr);
1527  kints = fNiofex[ke2-1];
1528  mnfixp(kints-1, ierr);
1529 
1530 //*-*- ......................Fill in the rest of the points
1531  for(inew = next; inew <= nptu; ++inew) {
1532 //*-* find the two neighbouring points with largest separation
1533  bigdis = 0;
1534 
1535  for(iold = 1; iold <= inew - 1; ++iold) {
1536  i2 = iold + 1;
1537 
1538  if(i2 == inew)
1539  i2 = 1;
1540 
1541  d__1 = scalx*(xptu[iold-1] - xptu[i2-1]);
1542  d__2 = scaly*(yptu[iold-1] - yptu[i2-1]);
1543  dist = d__1*d__1 + d__2*d__2;
1544 
1545  if(dist > bigdis) {
1546  bigdis = dist;
1547  idist = iold;
1548  }
1549  }
1550 
1551  i1 = idist;
1552  i2 = i1 + 1;
1553 
1554  if(i2 == inew)
1555  i2 = 1;
1556 
1557 //*-*- next point goes between I1 and I2
1558  a1 = .5;
1559  a2 = .5;
1560 L300:
1561  fXmidcr = a1*xptu[i1-1] + a2*xptu[i2-1];
1562  fYmidcr = a1*yptu[i1-1] + a2*yptu[i2-1];
1563  xdir = yptu[i2-1] - yptu[i1-1];
1564  ydir = xptu[i1-1] - xptu[i2-1];
1565  sclfac = max(fabs(xdir*scalx), fabs(ydir*scaly));
1566  fXdircr = xdir / sclfac;
1567  fYdircr = ydir / sclfac;
1568  fKe1cr = ke1;
1569  fKe2cr = ke2;
1570 //*-*- Find the contour crossing point along DIR
1571  fAmin = abest;
1572  mncros(aopt, iercr);
1573 
1574  if(iercr > 1) {
1575 //*-*- If cannot find mid-point, try closer to point 1
1576  if(a1 > .5) {
1577  if(fISW[4] >= 0) {
1578  printf(" MNCONT CANNOT FIND NEXT POINT ON CONTOUR. ONLY %3d POINTS FOUND.\n", nowpts);
1579  }
1580 
1581  goto L950;
1582  }
1583 
1584  mnwarn("W", "MNContour ", "Cannot find midpoint, try closer.");
1585  a1 = .75;
1586  a2 = .25;
1587  goto L300;
1588  }
1589 
1590 //*-*- Contour has been located, insert new point in list
1591  for(move = nowpts; move >= i1 + 1; --move) {
1592  xptu[move] = xptu[move-1];
1593  yptu[move] = yptu[move-1];
1594  }
1595 
1596  ++nowpts;
1597  xptu[i1] = fXmidcr + fXdircr*aopt;
1598  yptu[i1] = fYmidcr + fYdircr*aopt;
1599  }
1600 
1601 L950:
1602 
1603  ierrf = nowpts;
1604  fCstatu = "SUCCESSFUL";
1605 
1606  if(nowpts < nptu)
1607  fCstatu = "INCOMPLETE";
1608 
1609 //*-*- make a lineprinter plot of the contour
1610  if(fISW[4] >= 0) {
1611  fXpt[0] = u1min;
1612  fYpt[0] = u2min;
1613  fChpt[0] = ' ';
1614  nall = min(nowpts + 1, 101);
1615 
1616  for(i = 2; i <= nall; ++i) {
1617  fXpt[i-1] = xptu[i-2];
1618  fYpt[i-1] = yptu[i-2];
1619  fChpt[i-1] = 'X';
1620  }
1621 
1622  fChpt[nall] = 0;
1623  printf(" Y-AXIS: PARAMETER %3d %s\n", ke2, fCpnam[ke2-1].c_str());
1624 
1625  mnplot(fXpt, fYpt, fChpt, nall, fNpagwd, fNpagln);
1626 
1627  printf(" X-AXIS: PARAMETER %3d %s\n", ke1, fCpnam[ke1-1].c_str());
1628  }
1629 
1630 //*-*- print out the coordinates around the contour
1631  if(fISW[4] >= 1) {
1632  npcol = (nowpts + 1) / 2;
1633  nfcol = nowpts / 2;
1634  printf("%5d POINTS ON CONTOUR. FMIN=%13.5e ERRDEF=%11.3g\n", nowpts, abest, fUp);
1635  printf(" %s%s%s%s\n", fCpnam[ke1-1].c_str(),
1636  fCpnam[ke2-1].c_str(),
1637  fCpnam[ke1-1].c_str(),
1638  fCpnam[ke2-1].c_str());
1639 
1640  for(line = 1; line <= nfcol; ++line) {
1641  lr = line + npcol;
1642  printf(" %5d%13.5e%13.5e %5d%13.5e%13.5e\n", line, xptu[line-1], yptu[line-1], lr, xptu[lr-1], yptu[lr-1]);
1643  }
1644 
1645  if(nfcol < npcol) {
1646  printf(" %5d%13.5e%13.5e\n", npcol, xptu[npcol-1], yptu[npcol-1]);
1647  }
1648  }
1649 
1650 //*-*- . . contour finished. reset v
1651  fItaur = 1;
1652  mnfree(1);
1653  mnfree(1);
1654  i__1 = mpar*(mpar + 1) / 2;
1655 
1656  for(j = 1; j <= i__1; ++j) {
1657  fVhmat[j-1] = fVthmat[j-1];
1658  }
1659 
1660  for(i = 1; i <= mpar; ++i) {
1661  fGlobcc[i-1] = fCONTgcc[i-1];
1662  fWerr[i-1] = fCONTw[i-1];
1663  fX[i-1] = fXt[i-1];
1664  }
1665 
1666  mninex(fX);
1667  fEDM = sigsav;
1668  fAmin = abest;
1669  fISW[1] = isw2;
1670  fISW[3] = isw4;
1671  fDcovar = dc;
1672  fItaur = 0;
1673  fNfcnmx = nfmxin;
1674  fIstrat = istrav;
1675  fU[ke1-1] = u1min;
1676  fU[ke2-1] = u2min;
1677  goto L2000;
1678 //*-*- Error returns
1679 L1350:
1680  printf(" INVALID PARAMETER NUMBERS.\n");
1681  goto L1450;
1682 L1400:
1683  printf(" LESS THAN FOUR POINTS REQUESTED.\n");
1684 L1450:
1685  ierrf = -1;
1686  fCstatu = "USER ERROR";
1687  goto L2000;
1688 L1500:
1689  printf(" MNCONT UNABLE TO FIND FOUR POINTS.\n");
1690  fU[ke1-1] = u1min;
1691  fU[ke2-1] = u2min;
1692  ierrf = 0;
1693  fCstatu = "FAILED";
1694 L2000:
1695  fCfrom = "MNContour ";
1696  fNfcnfr = nfcnco;
1697 } /* mncont_ */
1698 
1699 //______________________________________________________________________________
1700 void TMinuit::mncrck(string cardbuf, int maxcwd, string& comand, int& lnc,
1701  int mxp, double* plist, int& llist, int& ierr, int) {
1702 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*Cracks the free-format input*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
1703 //*-* ============================
1704 //*-* Cracks the free-format input, expecting zero or more
1705 //*-* alphanumeric fields (which it joins into COMAND(1:LNC))
1706 //*-* followed by one or more numeric fields separated by
1707 //*-* blanks and/or one comma. The numeric fields are put into
1708 //*-* the LLIST (but at most MXP) elements of PLIST.
1709 //*-* IERR = 0 if no errors,
1710 //*-* = 1 if error(s).
1711 //*-*
1712 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
1713  /* Initialized data */
1714 
1715  char* cnull = 0;
1716  const char* cnumer = "123456789-.0+";
1717 
1718  /* Local variables */
1719  int ifld, iend, lend, left, nreq, ipos, kcmnd, nextb, ic, ibegin, ltoadd;
1720  int ielmnt, lelmnt[25], nelmnt;
1721  string ctemp;
1722  char* celmnt[25];
1723  char command[25];
1724 
1725  /* Function Body */
1726  char* crdbuf = (char*)cardbuf.c_str();
1727  lend = cardbuf.size();
1728  ielmnt = 0;
1729  nextb = 1;
1730  ierr = 0;
1731 //*-*- . . . . loop over words CELMNT
1732 L10:
1733 
1734  for(ipos = nextb; ipos <= lend; ++ipos) {
1735  ibegin = ipos;
1736 
1737  if(crdbuf[ipos-1] == ' ')
1738  continue;
1739 
1740  if(crdbuf[ipos-1] == ',')
1741  goto L250;
1742 
1743  goto L150;
1744  }
1745 
1746  goto L300;
1747 L150:
1748 
1749 //*-*- found beginning of word, look for end
1750  for(ipos = ibegin + 1; ipos <= lend; ++ipos) {
1751  if(crdbuf[ipos-1] == ' ')
1752  goto L250;
1753 
1754  if(crdbuf[ipos-1] == ',')
1755  goto L250;
1756  }
1757 
1758  ipos = lend + 1;
1759 L250:
1760  iend = ipos - 1;
1761  ++ielmnt;
1762 
1763  if(iend >= ibegin)
1764  celmnt[ielmnt-1] = &crdbuf[ibegin-1];
1765  else
1766  celmnt[ielmnt-1] = cnull;
1767 
1768  lelmnt[ielmnt-1] = iend - ibegin + 1;
1769 
1770  if(lelmnt[ielmnt-1] > 19) {
1771  printf(" MINUIT WARNING: INPUT DATA WORD TOO LONG.\n");
1772  ctemp = cardbuf.substr(ibegin-1, iend-ibegin+1);
1773  printf(" ORIGINAL:%s\n", ctemp.c_str());
1774  printf(" TRUNCATED TO:%s\n", celmnt[ielmnt-1]);
1775  lelmnt[ielmnt-1] = 19;
1776  }
1777 
1778  if(ipos >= lend)
1779  goto L300;
1780 
1781  if(ielmnt >= 25)
1782  goto L300;
1783 
1784 //*-*- look for comma or beginning of next word
1785  for(ipos = iend + 1; ipos <= lend; ++ipos) {
1786  if(crdbuf[ipos-1] == ' ')
1787  continue;
1788 
1789  nextb = ipos;
1790 
1791  if(crdbuf[ipos-1] == ',')
1792  nextb = ipos + 1;
1793 
1794  goto L10;
1795  }
1796 
1797 //*-*- All elements found, join the alphabetic ones to
1798 //*-*- form a command
1799 L300:
1800  nelmnt = ielmnt;
1801  command[0] = ' ';
1802  command[1] = 0;
1803  lnc = 1;
1804  plist[0] = 0;
1805  llist = 0;
1806 
1807  if(ielmnt == 0)
1808  goto L900;
1809 
1810  kcmnd = 0;
1811 
1812  for(ielmnt = 1; ielmnt <= nelmnt; ++ielmnt) {
1813  if(celmnt[ielmnt-1] == cnull)
1814  goto L450;
1815 
1816  for(ic = 1; ic <= 13; ++ic) {
1817  if(*celmnt[ielmnt-1] == cnumer[ic-1])
1818  goto L450;
1819  }
1820 
1821  if(kcmnd >= maxcwd)
1822  continue;
1823 
1824  left = maxcwd - kcmnd;
1825  ltoadd = lelmnt[ielmnt-1];
1826 
1827  if(ltoadd > left)
1828  ltoadd = left;
1829 
1830  strncpy(&command[kcmnd], celmnt[ielmnt-1], ltoadd);
1831  kcmnd += ltoadd;
1832 
1833  if(kcmnd == maxcwd)
1834  continue;
1835 
1836  command[kcmnd] = ' ';
1837  ++kcmnd;
1838  command[kcmnd] = 0;
1839  }
1840 
1841  lnc = kcmnd;
1842  goto L900;
1843 L450:
1844  lnc = kcmnd;
1845 //*-*- . . . . we have come to a numeric field
1846  llist = 0;
1847 
1848  for(ifld = ielmnt; ifld <= nelmnt; ++ifld) {
1849  ++llist;
1850 
1851  if(llist > mxp) {
1852  nreq = nelmnt - ielmnt + 1;
1853  printf(" MINUIT WARNING IN MNCRCK: \n");
1854  printf(" COMMAND HAS INPUT %5d NUMERIC FIELDS, BUT MINUIT CAN ACCEPT ONLY%3d\n", nreq, mxp);
1855  goto L900;
1856  }
1857 
1858  if(celmnt[ifld-1] == cnull)
1859  plist[llist-1] = 0;
1860  else {
1861  sscanf(celmnt[ifld-1], "%lf", &plist[llist-1]);
1862  }
1863  }
1864 
1865 //*-*- end loop over numeric fields
1866 L900:
1867 
1868  if(lnc <= 0)
1869  lnc = 1;
1870 
1871  comand = command;
1872 } /* mncrck_ */
1873 
1874 //______________________________________________________________________________
1875 void TMinuit::mncros(double& aopt, int& iercr) {
1876 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*Find point where MNEVAL=AMIN+UP*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
1877 //*-* ===============================
1878 //*-* Find point where MNEVAL=AMIN+UP, along the line through
1879 //*-* XMIDCR,YMIDCR with direction XDIRCR,YDIRCR, where X and Y
1880 //*-* are parameters KE1CR and KE2CR. If KE2CR=0 (from MINOS),
1881 //*-* only KE1CR is varied. From MNCONT, both are varied.
1882 //*-* Crossing point is at
1883 //*-* (U(KE1),U(KE2)) = (XMID,YMID) + AOPT*(XDIR,YDIR)
1884 //*-*
1885 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
1886 
1887  /* Local variables */
1888  double alsb[3], flsb[3], bmin, bmax, zmid, sdev, zdir, zlim;
1889  double coeff[3], aleft, aulim, fdist, adist, aminsv;
1890  double anext, fnext, slope, s1, s2, x1, x2, ecarmn, ecarmx;
1891  double determ, rt, smalla, aright, aim, tla, tlf, dfda, ecart;
1892  int iout=0, i, ileft, ierev, maxlk, ibest, ik, it;
1893  int noless, iworst=0, iright, itoohi, kex, ipt;
1894  bool ldebug;
1895  const char* chsign;
1896  x2 = 0;
1897 
1898  ldebug = fIdbg[6] >= 1;
1899  aminsv = fAmin;
1900 //*-*- convergence when F is within TLF of AIM and next prediction
1901 //*-*- of AOPT is within TLA of previous value of AOPT
1902  aim = fAmin + fUp;
1903  tlf = fUp*.01;
1904  tla = .01;
1905  fXpt[0] = 0;
1906  fYpt[0] = aim;
1907  fChpt[0] = ' ';
1908  ipt = 1;
1909 
1910  if(fKe2cr == 0) {
1911  fXpt[1] = -1;
1912  fYpt[1] = fAmin;
1913  fChpt[1] = '.';
1914  ipt = 2;
1915  }
1916 
1917 //*-*- find the largest allowed A
1918  aulim = 100;
1919 
1920  for(ik = 1; ik <= 2; ++ik) {
1921  if(ik == 1) {
1922  kex = fKe1cr;
1923  zmid = fXmidcr;
1924  zdir = fXdircr;
1925  } else {
1926  if(fKe2cr == 0)
1927  continue;
1928 
1929  kex = fKe2cr;
1930  zmid = fYmidcr;
1931  zdir = fYdircr;
1932  }
1933 
1934  if(fNvarl[kex-1] <= 1)
1935  continue;
1936 
1937  if(zdir == 0)
1938  continue;
1939 
1940  zlim = fAlim[kex-1];
1941 
1942  if(zdir > 0)
1943  zlim = fBlim[kex-1];
1944 
1945  aulim = min(aulim, (zlim - zmid) / zdir);
1946  }
1947 
1948 //*-*- LSB = Line Search Buffer
1949 //*-*- first point
1950  anext = 0;
1951  aopt = anext;
1952  fLimset = false;
1953 
1954  if(aulim < aopt + tla)
1955  fLimset = true;
1956 
1957  mneval(anext, fnext, ierev);
1958 
1959 //*-* debug printout:
1960  if(ldebug) {
1961  printf(" MNCROS: calls=%8d AIM=%10.5f F,A=%10.5f%10.5f\n", fNfcn, aim, fnext, aopt);
1962  }
1963 
1964  if(ierev > 0)
1965  goto L900;
1966 
1967  if(fLimset && fnext <= aim)
1968  goto L930;
1969 
1970  ++ipt;
1971  fXpt[ipt-1] = anext;
1972  fYpt[ipt-1] = fnext;
1973  fChpt[ipt-1] = charal[ipt-1];
1974  alsb[0] = anext;
1975  flsb[0] = fnext;
1976  fnext = max(fnext, aminsv + fUp*.1);
1977  aopt = sqrt(fUp / (fnext - aminsv)) - 1;
1978 
1979  if(fabs(fnext - aim) < tlf)
1980  goto L800;
1981 
1982  if(aopt < -.5)
1983  aopt = -.5;
1984 
1985  if(aopt > 1)
1986  aopt = 1;
1987 
1988  fLimset = false;
1989 
1990  if(aopt > aulim) {
1991  aopt = aulim;
1992  fLimset = true;
1993  }
1994 
1995  mneval(aopt, fnext, ierev);
1996 
1997 //*-* debug printout:
1998  if(ldebug) {
1999  printf(" MNCROS: calls=%8d AIM=%10.5f F,A=%10.5f%10.5f\n", fNfcn, aim, fnext, aopt);
2000  }
2001 
2002  if(ierev > 0)
2003  goto L900;
2004 
2005  if(fLimset && fnext <= aim)
2006  goto L930;
2007 
2008  alsb[1] = aopt;
2009  ++ipt;
2010  fXpt[ipt-1] = alsb[1];
2011  fYpt[ipt-1] = fnext;
2012  fChpt[ipt-1] = charal[ipt-1];
2013  flsb[1] = fnext;
2014  dfda = (flsb[1] - flsb[0]) / (alsb[1] - alsb[0]);
2015 
2016 //*-*- DFDA must be positive on the contour
2017  if(dfda > 0)
2018  goto L460;
2019 
2020 L300:
2021  mnwarn("D", "MNCROS ", "Looking for slope of the right sign");
2022  maxlk = 15 - ipt;
2023 
2024  for(it = 1; it <= maxlk; ++it) {
2025  alsb[0] = alsb[1];
2026  flsb[0] = flsb[1];
2027  aopt = alsb[0] + double(it)*.2;
2028  fLimset = false;
2029 
2030  if(aopt > aulim) {
2031  aopt = aulim;
2032  fLimset = true;
2033  }
2034 
2035  mneval(aopt, fnext, ierev);
2036 
2037 //*-* debug printout:
2038  if(ldebug) {
2039  printf(" MNCROS: calls=%8d AIM=%10.5f F,A=%10.5f%10.5f\n", fNfcn, aim, fnext, aopt);
2040  }
2041 
2042  if(ierev > 0)
2043  goto L900;
2044 
2045  if(fLimset && fnext <= aim)
2046  goto L930;
2047 
2048  alsb[1] = aopt;
2049  ++ipt;
2050  fXpt[ipt-1] = alsb[1];
2051  fYpt[ipt-1] = fnext;
2052  fChpt[ipt-1] = charal[ipt-1];
2053  flsb[1] = fnext;
2054  dfda = (flsb[1] - flsb[0]) / (alsb[1] - alsb[0]);
2055 
2056  if(dfda > 0)
2057  goto L450;
2058  }
2059 
2060  mnwarn("W", "MNCROS ", "Cannot find slope of the right sign");
2061  goto L950;
2062 L450:
2063 //*-*- we have two points with the right slope
2064 L460:
2065  aopt = alsb[1] + (aim - flsb[1]) / dfda;
2066  fdist = min(fabs(aim - flsb[0]), fabs(aim - flsb[1]));
2067  adist = min(fabs(aopt - alsb[0]), fabs(aopt - alsb[1]));
2068  tla = .01;
2069 
2070  if(fabs(aopt) > 1)
2071  tla = fabs(aopt)*.01;
2072 
2073  if(adist < tla && fdist < tlf)
2074  goto L800;
2075 
2076  if(ipt >= 15)
2077  goto L950;
2078 
2079  bmin = min(alsb[0], alsb[1]) - 1;
2080 
2081  if(aopt < bmin)
2082  aopt = bmin;
2083 
2084  bmax = max(alsb[0], alsb[1]) + 1;
2085 
2086  if(aopt > bmax)
2087  aopt = bmax;
2088 
2089 //*-*- Try a third point
2090  fLimset = false;
2091 
2092  if(aopt > aulim) {
2093  aopt = aulim;
2094  fLimset = true;
2095  }
2096 
2097  mneval(aopt, fnext, ierev);
2098 
2099 //*-* debug printout:
2100  if(ldebug) {
2101  printf(" MNCROS: calls=%8d AIM=%10.5f F,A=%10.5f%10.5f\n", fNfcn, aim, fnext, aopt);
2102  }
2103 
2104  if(ierev > 0)
2105  goto L900;
2106 
2107  if(fLimset && fnext <= aim)
2108  goto L930;
2109 
2110  alsb[2] = aopt;
2111  ++ipt;
2112  fXpt[ipt-1] = alsb[2];
2113  fYpt[ipt-1] = fnext;
2114  fChpt[ipt-1] = charal[ipt-1];
2115  flsb[2] = fnext;
2116 //*-*- now we have three points, ask how many <AIM
2117  ecarmn = fabs(fnext-aim);
2118  ibest = 3;
2119  ecarmx = 0;
2120  noless = 0;
2121 
2122  for(i = 1; i <= 3; ++i) {
2123  ecart = fabs(flsb[i-1] - aim);
2124 
2125  if(ecart > ecarmx) {
2126  ecarmx = ecart;
2127  iworst = i;
2128  }
2129 
2130  if(ecart < ecarmn) {
2131  ecarmn = ecart;
2132  ibest = i;
2133  }
2134 
2135  if(flsb[i-1] < aim)
2136  ++noless;
2137  }
2138 
2139 //*-*- if at least one on each side of AIM, fit a parabola
2140  if(noless == 1 || noless == 2)
2141  goto L500;
2142 
2143 //*-*- if all three are above AIM, third must be closest to AIM
2144  if(noless == 0 && ibest != 3)
2145  goto L950;
2146 
2147 //*-*- if all three below, and third is not best, then slope
2148 //*-*- has again gone negative, look for positive slope.
2149  if(noless == 3 && ibest != 3) {
2150  alsb[1] = alsb[2];
2151  flsb[1] = flsb[2];
2152  goto L300;
2153  }
2154 
2155 //*-*- in other cases, new straight line thru last two points
2156  alsb[iworst-1] = alsb[2];
2157  flsb[iworst-1] = flsb[2];
2158  dfda = (flsb[1] - flsb[0]) / (alsb[1] - alsb[0]);
2159  goto L460;
2160 //*-*- parabola fit
2161 L500:
2162  mnpfit(alsb, flsb, 3, coeff, sdev);
2163 
2164  if(coeff[2] <= 0) {
2165  mnwarn("D", "MNCROS ", "Curvature is negative near contour line.");
2166  }
2167 
2168  determ = coeff[1]*coeff[1] - coeff[2]*4*(coeff[0] - aim);
2169 
2170  if(determ <= 0) {
2171  mnwarn("D", "MNCROS ", "Problem 2, impossible determinant");
2172  goto L950;
2173  }
2174 
2175 //*-*- Find which root is the right one
2176  rt = sqrt(determ);
2177  x1 = (-coeff[1] + rt) / (coeff[2]*2);
2178  x2 = (-coeff[1] - rt) / (coeff[2]*2);
2179  s1 = coeff[1] + x1*2*coeff[2];
2180  s2 = coeff[1] + x2*2*coeff[2];
2181 
2182  if(s1*s2 > 0) {
2183  printf(" MNCONTour problem 1\n");
2184  }
2185 
2186  aopt = x1;
2187  slope = s1;
2188 
2189  if(s2 > 0) {
2190  aopt = x2;
2191  slope = s2;
2192  }
2193 
2194 //*-*- ask if converged
2195  tla = .01;
2196 
2197  if(fabs(aopt) > 1)
2198  tla = fabs(aopt)*.01;
2199 
2200  if(fabs(aopt - alsb[ibest-1]) < tla && fabs(flsb[ibest-1] - aim) < tlf) {
2201  goto L800;
2202  }
2203 
2204  if(ipt >= 15)
2205  goto L950;
2206 
2207 //*-*- see if proposed point is in acceptable zone between L and R
2208 //*-*- first find ILEFT, IRIGHT, IOUT and IBEST
2209  ileft = 0;
2210  iright = 0;
2211  ibest = 1;
2212  ecarmx = 0;
2213  ecarmn = fabs(aim - flsb[0]);
2214 
2215  for(i = 1; i <= 3; ++i) {
2216  ecart = fabs(flsb[i-1] - aim);
2217 
2218  if(ecart < ecarmn) {
2219  ecarmn = ecart;
2220  ibest = i;
2221  }
2222 
2223  if(ecart > ecarmx) {
2224  ecarmx = ecart;
2225  }
2226 
2227  if(flsb[i-1] > aim) {
2228  if(iright == 0)
2229  iright = i;
2230  else if(flsb[i-1] > flsb[iright-1])
2231  iout = i;
2232  else {
2233  iout = iright;
2234  iright = i;
2235  }
2236  } else if(ileft == 0)
2237  ileft = i;
2238  else if(flsb[i-1] < flsb[ileft-1])
2239  iout = i;
2240  else {
2241  iout = ileft;
2242  ileft = i;
2243  }
2244  }
2245 
2246 //*-*- avoid keeping a very bad point next time around
2247  if(ecarmx > fabs(flsb[iout-1] - aim)*10) {
2248  aopt = aopt*.5 + (alsb[iright-1] + alsb[ileft-1])*.25;
2249  }
2250 
2251 //*-*- knowing ILEFT and IRIGHT, get acceptable window
2252  smalla = tla*.1;
2253 
2254  if(slope*smalla > tlf)
2255  smalla = tlf / slope;
2256 
2257  aleft = alsb[ileft-1] + smalla;
2258  aright = alsb[iright-1] - smalla;
2259 
2260 //*-*- move proposed point AOPT into window if necessary
2261  if(aopt < aleft)
2262  aopt = aleft;
2263 
2264  if(aopt > aright)
2265  aopt = aright;
2266 
2267  if(aleft > aright)
2268  aopt = (aleft + aright)*.5;
2269 
2270 //*-*- see if proposed point outside limits (should be impossible!)
2271  fLimset = false;
2272 
2273  if(aopt > aulim) {
2274  aopt = aulim;
2275  fLimset = true;
2276  }
2277 
2278 //*-*- Evaluate function at new point AOPT
2279  mneval(aopt, fnext, ierev);
2280 
2281 //*-* debug printout:
2282  if(ldebug) {
2283  printf(" MNCROS: calls=%8d AIM=%10.5f F,A=%10.5f%10.5f\n", fNfcn, aim, fnext, aopt);
2284  }
2285 
2286  if(ierev > 0)
2287  goto L900;
2288 
2289  if(fLimset && fnext <= aim)
2290  goto L930;
2291 
2292  ++ipt;
2293  fXpt[ipt-1] = aopt;
2294  fYpt[ipt-1] = fnext;
2295  fChpt[ipt-1] = charal[ipt-1];
2296 //*-*- Replace odd point by new one
2297  alsb[iout-1] = aopt;
2298  flsb[iout-1] = fnext;
2299 //*-*- the new point may not be the best, but it is the only one
2300 //*-*- which could be good enough to pass convergence criteria
2301  ibest = iout;
2302  goto L500;
2303 
2304 //*-*- Contour has been located, return point to MNCONT OR MINOS
2305 L800:
2306  iercr = 0;
2307  goto L1000;
2308 //*-*- error in the minimization
2309 L900:
2310 
2311  if(ierev == 1)
2312  goto L940;
2313 
2314  goto L950;
2315 //*-*- parameter up against limit
2316 L930:
2317  iercr = 1;
2318  goto L1000;
2319 //*-*- too many calls to FCN
2320 L940:
2321  iercr = 2;
2322  goto L1000;
2323 //*-*- cannot find next point
2324 L950:
2325  iercr = 3;
2326 //*-*- in any case
2327 L1000:
2328 
2329  if(ldebug) {
2330  itoohi = 0;
2331 
2332  for(i = 1; i <= ipt; ++i) {
2333  if(fYpt[i-1] > aim + fUp) {
2334  fYpt[i-1] = aim + fUp;
2335  fChpt[i-1] = '+';
2336  itoohi = 1;
2337  }
2338  }
2339 
2340  fChpt[ipt] = 0;
2341  chsign = "POSI";
2342 
2343  if(fXdircr < 0)
2344  chsign = "NEGA";
2345 
2346  if(fKe2cr == 0) {
2347  printf(" %sTIVE MINOS ERROR, PARAMETER %3d\n", chsign, fKe1cr);
2348  }
2349 
2350  if(itoohi == 1) {
2351  printf("POINTS LABELLED '+' WERE TOO HIGH TO PLOT.\n");
2352  }
2353 
2354  if(iercr == 1) {
2355  printf("RIGHTMOST POINT IS UP AGAINST LIMIT.\n");
2356  }
2357 
2358  mnplot(fXpt, fYpt, fChpt, ipt, fNpagwd, fNpagln);
2359  }
2360 } /* mncros_ */
2361 
2362 //______________________________________________________________________________
2363 void TMinuit::mncuve() {
2364 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*Makes sure that the current point is a local minimum*-*-*-*-*
2365 //*-* ====================================================
2366 //*-* Makes sure that the current point is a local
2367 //*-* minimum and that the error matrix exists,
2368 //*-* or at least something good enough for MINOS and MNCONT
2369 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
2370 
2371  /* Local variables */
2372  double dxdi, wint;
2373  int ndex, iext, i, j;
2374 
2375  if(fISW[3] < 1) {
2376  printf(" FUNCTION MUST BE MINIMIZED BEFORE CALLING %s\n", fCfrom.c_str());
2377  fApsi = fEpsi;
2378  mnmigr();
2379  }
2380 
2381  if(fISW[1] < 3) {
2382  mnhess();
2383 
2384  if(fISW[1] < 1) {
2385  mnwarn("W", fCfrom.c_str(), "NO ERROR MATRIX. WILL IMPROVISE.");
2386 
2387  for(i = 1; i <= fNpar; ++i) {
2388  ndex = i*(i-1) / 2;
2389 
2390  for(j = 1; j <= i-1; ++j) {
2391  ++ndex;
2392  fVhmat[ndex-1] = 0;
2393  }
2394 
2395  ++ndex;
2396 
2397  if(fG2[i-1] <= 0) {
2398  wint = fWerr[i-1];
2399  iext = fNexofi[i-1];
2400 
2401  if(fNvarl[iext-1] > 1) {
2402  mndxdi(fX[i-1], i-1, dxdi);
2403 
2404  if(fabs(dxdi) < .001)
2405  wint = .01;
2406  else
2407  wint /= fabs(dxdi);
2408  }
2409 
2410  fG2[i-1] = fUp / (wint*wint);
2411  }
2412 
2413  fVhmat[ndex-1] = 2 / fG2[i-1];
2414  }
2415 
2416  fISW[1] = 1;
2417  fDcovar = 1;
2418  } else
2419  mnwerr();
2420  }
2421 } /* mncuve_ */
2422 
2423 //______________________________________________________________________________
2424 void TMinuit::mnderi() {
2425 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*Calculates the first derivatives of FCN (GRD)*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
2426 //*-* =============================================
2427 //*-* Calculates the first derivatives of FCN (GRD),
2428 //*-* either by finite differences or by transforming the user-
2429 //*-* supplied derivatives to internal coordinates,
2430 //*-* according to whether fISW[2] is zero or one.
2431 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
2432 
2433  /* Local variables */
2434  double step, dfmin, stepb4, dd, df, fs1;
2435  double tlrstp, tlrgrd, epspri, optstp, stpmax, stpmin, fs2, grbfor=0, d1d2, xtf;
2436  int icyc, ncyc, iint, iext, i, nparx;
2437  bool ldebug;
2438 
2439  nparx = fNpar;
2440  ldebug = fIdbg[2] >= 1;
2441 
2442  if(fAmin == fUndefi)
2443  mnamin();
2444 
2445  if(fISW[2] == 1)
2446  goto L100;
2447 
2448  if(ldebug) {
2449 //*-*- make sure starting at the right place
2450  mninex(fX);
2451  nparx = fNpar;
2452  Eval(nparx, fGin, fs1, fU, 4);
2453  ++fNfcn;
2454 
2455  if(fs1 != fAmin) {
2456  df = fAmin - fs1;
2457  mnwarn("D", "MNDERI", local_Form("function value differs from AMIN by %12.3g", df).c_str());
2458  fAmin = fs1;
2459  }
2460 
2461  printf(" FIRST DERIVATIVE DEBUG PRINTOUT. MNDERI\n");
2462  printf(" PAR DERIV STEP MINSTEP OPTSTEP D1-D2 2ND DRV\n");
2463  }
2464 
2465  dfmin = fEpsma2*8*(fabs(fAmin) + fUp);
2466 
2467  if(fIstrat <= 0) {
2468  ncyc = 2;
2469  tlrstp = .5;
2470  tlrgrd = .1;
2471  } else if(fIstrat == 1) {
2472  ncyc = 3;
2473  tlrstp = .3;
2474  tlrgrd = .05;
2475  } else {
2476  ncyc = 5;
2477  tlrstp = .1;
2478  tlrgrd = .02;
2479  }
2480 
2481 //*-*- loop over variable parameters
2482  for(i = 1; i <= fNpar; ++i) {
2483  epspri = fEpsma2 + fabs(fGrd[i-1]*fEpsma2);
2484 //*-*- two-point derivatives always assumed necessary
2485 //*-*- maximum number of cycles over step size depends on strategy
2486  xtf = fX[i-1];
2487  stepb4 = 0;
2488 
2489 //*-*- loop as little as possible here!/
2490  for(icyc = 1; icyc <= ncyc; ++icyc) {
2491 //*-*- ........ theoretically best step
2492  //double g2before = fG2[i-1]; // Rolf addition
2493  optstp = sqrt(dfmin / (fabs(fG2[i-1]) + epspri));
2494 //*-*- step cannot decrease by more than a factor of ten
2495  step = max(optstp, fabs(fGstep[i-1]*.1));
2496 
2497 //*-*- but if parameter has limits, max step size = 0.5
2498  if(fGstep[i-1] < 0 && step > .5)
2499  step = .5;
2500 
2501 //*-*- and not more than ten times the previous step
2502  stpmax = fabs(fGstep[i-1])*10;
2503 
2504  if(step > stpmax)
2505  step = stpmax;
2506 
2507 //*-*- minimum step size allowed by machine precision
2508  stpmin = fabs(fEpsma2*fX[i-1])*8;
2509 
2510  if(step < stpmin)
2511  step = stpmin;
2512 
2513 //*-*- end of iterations if step change less than factor 2
2514  if(fabs((step - stepb4) / step) < tlrstp)
2515  goto L50;
2516 
2517 //*-*- take step positive
2518  stepb4 = step;
2519 
2520  if(fGstep[i-1] > 0)
2521  fGstep[i-1] = fabs(step);
2522  else
2523  fGstep[i-1] = -fabs(step);
2524 
2525  stepb4 = step;
2526  fX[i-1] = xtf + step;
2527  mninex(fX);
2528  Eval(nparx, fGin, fs1, fU, 4);
2529  ++fNfcn;
2530 //*-*- take step negative
2531  fX[i-1] = xtf - step;
2532  mninex(fX);
2533  Eval(nparx, fGin, fs2, fU, 4);
2534  ++fNfcn;
2535  grbfor = fGrd[i-1];
2536  fGrd[i-1] = (fs1 - fs2) / (step*2);
2537  fG2[i-1] = (fs1 + fs2 - fAmin*2) / (step*step);
2538  fX[i-1] = xtf;
2539 
2540  if(ldebug) {
2541  d1d2 = (fs1 + fs2 - fAmin*2) / step;
2542  printf("%4d %20.6g %20.6g %20.6g %20.6g %20.12g %20.6g\n", i, fGrd[i-1], step, stpmin, optstp, grbfor, fG2[i-1]);
2543  //printf("%4d %20.12g %20.12g %20.12g %20.12g %20.12g %20.12g\n",i,dfmin,stepb4,g2before,epspri,fEpsma2,fAmin);
2544  }
2545 
2546 //*-*- see if another iteration is necessary
2547  if(fabs(grbfor - fGrd[i-1]) / (fabs(fGrd[i-1]) + dfmin/step) < tlrgrd)
2548  goto L50;
2549  }
2550 
2551 //*-*- end of ICYC loop. too many iterations
2552  if(ncyc == 1)
2553  goto L50;
2554 
2555  mnwarn("D", "MNDERI", local_Form("First derivative not converged. %g%g", fGrd[i-1], grbfor).c_str());
2556 L50:
2557  ;
2558  }
2559 
2560  mninex(fX);
2561  return;
2562 //*-*- . derivatives calc by fcn
2563 L100:
2564 
2565  for(iint = 1; iint <= fNpar; ++iint) {
2566  iext = fNexofi[iint-1];
2567 
2568  if(fNvarl[iext-1] <= 1) {
2569  fGrd[iint-1] = fGin[iext-1];
2570  } else {
2571  dd = (fBlim[iext-1] - fAlim[iext-1])*.5*cos(fX[iint-1]);
2572  fGrd[iint-1] = fGin[iext-1]*dd;
2573  }
2574  }
2575 } /* mnderi_ */
2576 
2577 //______________________________________________________________________________
2578 void TMinuit::mndxdi(double pint, int ipar, double& dxdi) {
2579 //*-*-*-*Calculates the transformation factor between ext/internal values*-*
2580 //*-* =====================================================================
2581 //*-* calculates the transformation factor between external and
2582 //*-* internal parameter values. this factor is one for
2583 //*-* parameters which are not limited. called from MNEMAT.
2584 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
2585 
2586  int i = fNexofi[ipar];
2587  dxdi = 1;
2588 
2589  if(fNvarl[i-1] > 1) {
2590  dxdi = fabs((fBlim[i-1] - fAlim[i-1])*cos(pint))*.5;
2591  }
2592 } /* mndxdi_ */
2593 
2594 //______________________________________________________________________________
2595 void TMinuit::mneig(double* a, int ndima, int n, int mits, double* work, double precis, int& ifault) {
2596 //*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*Compute matrix eigen values*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
2597 //*-* ===========================
2598  /* System generated locals */
2599  int a_offset;
2600  double d__1;
2601 
2602  /* Local variables */
2603  double b, c, f, h, r, s, hh, gl, pr, pt;
2604  int i, j, k, l, m=0, i0, i1, j1, m1, n1;
2605 
2606 //*-*- PRECIS is the machine precision EPSMAC
2607  /* Parameter adjustments */
2608  a_offset = ndima + 1;
2609  a -= a_offset;
2610  --work;
2611 
2612  /* Function Body */
2613  ifault = 1;
2614 
2615  i = n;
2616 
2617  for(i1 = 2; i1 <= n; ++i1) {
2618  l = i-2;
2619  f = a[i + (i-1)*ndima];
2620  gl = 0;
2621 
2622  if(l < 1)
2623  goto L25;
2624 
2625  for(k = 1; k <= l; ++k) {
2626  d__1 = a[i + k*ndima];
2627  gl += d__1*d__1;
2628  }
2629 
2630 L25:
2631  h = gl + f*f;
2632 
2633  if(gl > 1e-35)
2634  goto L30;
2635 
2636  work[i] = 0;
2637  work[n + i] = f;
2638  goto L65;
2639 L30:
2640  ++l;
2641  gl = sqrt(h);
2642 
2643  if(f >= 0)
2644  gl = -gl;
2645 
2646  work[n + i] = gl;
2647  h -= f*gl;
2648  a[i + (i-1)*ndima] = f - gl;
2649  f = 0;
2650 
2651  for(j = 1; j <= l; ++j) {
2652  a[j + i*ndima] = a[i + j*ndima] / h;
2653  gl = 0;
2654 
2655  for(k = 1; k <= j; ++k) {
2656  gl += a[j + k*ndima]*a[i + k*ndima];
2657  }
2658 
2659  if(j >= l)
2660  goto L47;
2661 
2662  j1 = j + 1;
2663 
2664  for(k = j1; k <= l; ++k) {
2665  gl += a[k + j*ndima]*a[i + k*ndima];
2666  }
2667 
2668 L47:
2669  work[n + j] = gl / h;
2670  f += gl*a[j + i*ndima];
2671  }
2672 
2673  hh = f / (h + h);
2674 
2675  for(j = 1; j <= l; ++j) {
2676  f = a[i + j*ndima];
2677  gl = work[n + j] - hh*f;
2678  work[n + j] = gl;
2679 
2680  for(k = 1; k <= j; ++k) {
2681  a[j + k*ndima] = a[j + k*ndima] - f*work[n + k] - gl*a[i + k*ndima];
2682  }
2683  }
2684 
2685  work[i] = h;
2686 L65:
2687  --i;
2688  }
2689 
2690  work[1] = 0;
2691  work[n + 1] = 0;
2692 
2693  for(i = 1; i <= n; ++i) {
2694  l = i-1;
2695 
2696  if(work[i] == 0 || l == 0)
2697  goto L100;
2698 
2699  for(j = 1; j <= l; ++j) {
2700  gl = 0;
